content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new compound structures have been successfully created on the map. The agent made repeated attempts to establish a Lab at Position(0.5, 2.5) – intended to supply Automation Science Packs for research – but placement and crafting operations failed due to API misuse and insufficient resources. Although the agent interacted with smelting furnaces (an iron furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)) to process ores, these appear to be pre‐existing facilities rather than newly built structures.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage for Entity Retrieval  
  – When calling get_entities, ensure the arguments match the defined signature. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) and do not supply unexpected positional parameters.

• Lab Placement  
  – Verify that a Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting to place one at a target location to prevent placement failures.

• Iteration over Entity Collections  
  – Confirm that objects expected to be iterables (for example, the result from get_entities) are not None before attempting to iterate over them.

• Lab Crafting and Resource Dependencies  
  – Before initiating lab crafting, check that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-plate, iron-gear-wheel, copper-plate, copper-cable, and electronic-circuit) are available and that the necessary crafting or smelting machinery is operational. This helps avoid errors related to missing ingredients and ensures that dependency chains are fully satisfied.
